section.title: listing all databases
section.para: You can use the mysqlmysql command to take a look at the databases, and to execute SQL queries on them. The screenshots below show you how. First, we log on to our MySQL server and execute the command show databasesshow(mysql) to see which databases exist on our mysql server.
section.screen: paul@barry:~$ mysql -u root ... mysql> show databases; +--------------------+ | Database | +--------------------+ | information_schema | | mysql | | wikidb | +--------------------+ 3 rows in set (0.01 sec)

section.title: using a database
section.para: Next we tell mysql to use one particular database with the use $databaseuse(mysql) command. This screenshot shows how to make wikidb the current database (in use).
section.screen:
mysql> use wikidb; Reading table information for completion of table and column names You can turn off this feature to get a quicker startup with -A
Database changed

section.title: creating databases
section.para: You can create a new database with the create databasecreate(mysql) command.
section.screen:
mysql> create database demodb; Query OK, 1 row affected (0.01 sec)
mysql> show databases; +--------------------+ | Database | +--------------------+ | information_schema | | demodb | | mysql | +--------------------+ 3 rows in set (0.00 sec)

section.title: access to databases
section.para: To give everyone access to a mysql database, use the grantgrant(mysql) command.
section.screen: mysql> grant all on demodb.* to paul@localhost IDENTIFIED BY "stargate"; Query OK, 0 rows affected (0.00 sec)
